hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversion After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When major crypto news triggers a >5% intraday price spike on elevated volume (>150% of 20-day average) but the bid-ask spread widens by >50% (indicating liquidity withdrawal), price will revert >60% of the spike within 48 hours as market makers re-enter and liquidity normalizes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes often see liquidity providers temporarily withdraw to avoid adverse selection, creating artificial gaps. As volatility subsides, market makers re-enter for spread capture, pushing price back toward pre-news equilibrium.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH 5-min candle shows >5% move from previous close
Bid-ask spread widens >50% from 1-hour pre-spike average
Order book depth on first 5 levels drops >30% on spike side
Regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (no STRESS)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 60% of initial spike move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds initial spike high/low by 1.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >40% of such spikes continue trending in same direction beyond 48 hours without significant retracement, hypothesis fails.
